title: “We Are Impressed!”
text: We agree with the other people when it comes to this place! My aunt and uncle live in texas so we all head to san antonio whenever we visit texas. You feel like your in another country san antonio is a beautiful place with lots of history like the Alamo is here. The westin is a great location right on the riverwalk with restaurants and shopping all around you and at night everything is all lit up and be sure to take the boat right. The westin rooms are nice size and decorated nicely the food is good and the staff was helpful.
author: {'username': 'christy31', 'num_cities': 15, 'num_helpful_votes': 199, 'num_reviews': 60, 'num_type_reviews': 19, 'id': '69D54221CB6E10CD86EE264FE26EAA6E', 'location': 'Portsmouth, Ohio'}

title: “Love this hotel.”
text:
I stayed here for four nights in October, 2010, and for two nights in May 2009. I loved it each time. Despite technically being a 'medium,' both rooms were small (as should be expected for New York). However, it was dark and quiet, which is exactly what I want out of a hotel in NYC. 
The bar is one of my favorites in the City (and serves as a great work space during the day), the Breslin was delicious, the room was clean at all times and the staff was helpful enough (though by no means effusive). My only complaint was that there weren't a lot of late-night food options within walking distance (pizza!?!?)... but that can easily be worked around.
All in all, the Ace is one of my favorite places to stay in NYC.

title: “really nice”
text:
while i would usually stay at the classic rittenhouse in philly, it was fully booked and i gave this hotel a try. for the money that the luxury rittenhouse asks, you can easily live like a king at this art-deco high-rise.
- good downtown location, especially if you're in philly for business.
- awesome views of the harbor if you stay on a high-enough floor.
- really cool seafood restaurant downstairs
- good, knowledgeable staff for a large hotel and in a city where this is rare
author: {'username': 'brennaena', 'num_cities': 3, 'num_helpful_votes': 4, 'num_reviews': 3, 'num_type_reviews': 3, 'id': '7BCE1202BA14D1E5A4F3A5A507940B67', 'location': 'chicago'}

title: “All Around Enjoyable”
text:
I stayed at Gild Hall in NYC this past weekend. The experience was excellent and the service was fantastic. Will definitely stay there again! I will list the pros and cons of this fabulous hotel:
Pros:
- Excellent front desk service and response to requests from my room
- Gorgeous decor 
- The most comfortable bed and sheets I have slept in at a hotel ... ever.
- Fantastic water pressure and excellent lighting in the bathroom for make-up
- Quiet location
Cons
- $15/day for internet service and $20+ cab fares to go uptown
- Doors to bathroom are clear/blurred, so if sharing a room, make sure you know them well
- Rate went up $100 / night from Friday night to Saturday night
author: {'username': 'KMacWilson', 'num_cities': 4, 'num_helpful_votes': 4, 'num_reviews': 4, 'num_type_reviews': 3, 'id': 'F434FA49840F218EE86907E3246888E9', 'location': 'Fort Mill, South Carolina'}

title: “Eastgate Tower”
text: The furniture is in desperate need of an update, but the sheets were new, the bed was comfortable, and it was the most spacious hotel room I've ever seen in New York. The shower was great and the bathroom included all the standard amenities we've come to expect. You can't beat the location! It's within walking distance of everything. The staff was cordial and accommodating.
